item.name: All CPUs maximum temperature
item.description: Among all processors and its cores.

item.name: All GPUs maximum temperature
item.description: Among all cards and its cores.

item.name: All motherboard sensors maximum temperature
item.description: Among all cards and its cores.

item.name: CPU temperature configuration status
item.description:
In some cases it could also mean GPU temperature, system voltage and fan speed.
Could refer to mini_ipmi_lmsensors.py, mini_ipmi_ohmr.py or mini_ipmi_bsdcpu.py.

trigger_prototype.name: cpu{#CPU}: CPU model or ID was changed
cpu{#CPU}: is throttling right now
cpu{#CPU}: no temperature info was found on CPU
cpu{#CPU}: temperature is above 60C
cpu{#CPU}: temperature was above 60C within past 24 hours
cpu{#CPU}: was throttled within past 24 hours
gpu{#GPUFAN}: fan speed is too low
gpu{#GPUMEM}: free video memory is less than 32Mb
gpu{#GPUTEMP}: temperature is above 70C
gpu{#GPUTEMP}: temperature was above 70C within past 24 hours
gpu{#GPU}: GPU model or ID was changed
gpu{#GPU}: no fan info was found on GPU
gpu{#GPU}: no temperature info was found on GPU
{#BRDFANNAME}: motherboard fan speed is too low
{#BRDTEMPNAME}: motherboard temperature is above 60C
{#BRDTEMPNAME}: motherboard temperature was above 60C within past 24 hours
{#P5V}: voltage is too high
{#P5V}: voltage is too low
{#P5V}: voltage was too high within past 24 hours
{#P5V}: voltage was too low within past 24 hours
{#P12V}: voltage is too high
{#P12V}: voltage is too low
{#P12V}: voltage was too high within past 24 hours
{#P12V}: voltage was too low within past 24 hours
{#P33V}: voltage is too high
{#P33V}: voltage is too low
{#P33V}: voltage was too high within past 24 hours
{#P33V}: voltage was too low within past 24 hours
{#VBAT}: CMOS battery voltage is too low
{#VCC3V}: voltage is too high
{#VCC3V}: voltage is too low
{#VCC3V}: voltage was too high within past 24 hours
{#VCC3V}: voltage was too low within past 24 hours
{#VCORE}: CPU voltage is too high
trigger_prototype.description: Each processor have individual threshold. OHMR usage must be tweaked (mini_ipmi_ohmr.py). Known incorrect measurements.

trigger_prototype.name: {#VCORE}: CPU voltage was too high within past 24 hours
trigger_prototype.description: Each processor have individual threshold. OHMR usage must be tweaked (mini_ipmi_ohmr.py). Known incorrect measurements.

trigger_prototype.name: {#VSB3V}: voltage is too high
{#VSB3V}: voltage is too low
{#VSB3V}: voltage was too high within past 24 hours
{#VSB3V}: voltage was too low within past 24 hours
{#VTT}: voltage is too high
trigger_prototype.description: Each processor have individual threshold. Tweak in mini_ipmi_ohmr.py before use.

trigger_prototype.name: {#VTT}: voltage was too high within past 24h
trigger_prototype.description: Each processor have individual threshold. Tweak in mini_ipmi_ohmr.py before use.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Assumed to be a placeholder NVMe
{#DISK}: Command line did not parse (mini-IPMI)
{#DISK}: Device open failed (mini-IPMI)
trigger_prototype.description: Probably no administrative permissions for smartctl or incorrect device name.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Disk temperature is critical
{#DISK}: Disk temperature is too high

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template mini-IPMI v2:mini.disk.temp[{#DISK}].last(#1)}<=25 and {Template mini-IPMI v2:mini.disk.temp[{#DISK}].last(#2)}<=25 and {Template mini-IPMI v2:mini.disk.temp[{#DISK}].last(#3)}<=25
trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Disk temperature is too low
trigger_prototype.description: Last and previous value were below 25.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Disk temperature was critical in past 24 hours
{#DISK}: Have no temperature sensor
{#DISK}: Is in SLEEP mode
{#DISK}: Is in STANDBY mode
{#DISK}: No temperature info was found on disk
{#DISK}: Something went wrong (mini-IPMI)
{#DISK}: Timeout exceeded while calling the disk (mini-IPMI)
trigger_prototype.description: Could indicate disk failure. Investigation is advised.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Unknown USB bridge

trigger.name: Disk temperature is too high
trigger.description: (depending on values from last 500 seconds) This one is disabled - individual disk trigger takes precedence.

trigger.name: Disk temperature was too high in past 24 hours
trigger.description: (depending on values from last day) This one is disabled - individual disk trigger takes precedence.

trigger.name: mini-IPMI: CPU binary was not found in PATH or manually
mini-IPMI: no CPUs were found for temperature test
mini-IPMI: no DISKs were found for temperature test
mini-IPMI: no GPUs were found for temperature test
mini-IPMI: no temperatures was found among CPUs
mini-IPMI: no temperatures was found among DISKs
mini-IPMI: no temperatures was found among GPUs
mini-IPMI: smartctl was not found in PATH or manually
mini-IPMI: something went wrong with CPU configuration
mini-IPMI: something went wrong with DISK configuration
mini-IPMI: something went wrong with DISK sending
mini-IPMI: template is assigned, but no CPU data is recieved
mini-IPMI: template is assigned, but no DISK data is recieved
mini-IPMI: too much data for CPU sending
mini-IPMI: too much data for DISK sending
